title: Hybrid Learning Environment Design in Healthcare: Applying the Huta-Gosling Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Theory and Practical Experience in Healthcare
context.additional_context: For Office/Administrative Professionals with Access to Digital Devices. Focus on Learning Environment Design Integrating Physical, Psychological, and Social Factors. Includes Case-Based Design for Adapting to Post-COVID-19 Educational Settings

learning_goals: Learners can analyze interactions between tool-task-social relationships in hybrid learning activities using the Activity-Centred Analysis and Design (ACAD) framework
Learners can apply a psychomotor-cognitive-social approach to design blended learning that addresses physical, mental, and relational well-being needs of healthcare education participants

Learners can develop two or more hybrid class scenarios for interacting with medium-sized learner groups (10â€“30 participants) using digital tools (video conferencing systems, LMS, collaboration platforms)

resources: Digital Collaboration Tools (ZOOM, Google Workspace, Moodle, etc.)
